alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Mathematics is at root a formal description of orderliness, and since the universe is orderly it should come as no surprise that the real world is well modeled mathematically. The mistake comes in turning this relationship on its head and expecting that every sequela of a mathematical model enjoys some real-world counterpart. This is akin to believing in the abilities of a fortuneteller on the basis of a few correct predictions."

- Keith Backman
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Mistake is to Expect that Every Sequela of a Mathematical Model Enjoys Some Real-World Counterpart
